item.title: Thick leaf fall in cycle lane; unable to cycle in it, 5th November
item.description:
On the uphill side of Fountain Drive there is very heavy leaf fall in the cycle lane. It's deep to cycle in, so riders are forced to veer out into the centre of the road, thus making the lane useless and increasing danger of collision with a road vehicle
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fountain Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe Heavy leaf fall in cycle lane, 5th November
item.description:
Thick leaf fall in north bound cycle lane up hill Camberwell Grove in bridge over the rail line, at the traffic lights. This is dedicated cycle lane which is impossible to avoid and it's fully of slippery wet leaves. A dangerous situation for anyone on a bike
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Grove, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clifden Mews Entrance Flytipping, 5th November

item.title: Damaged traffic light near Salvation Army, 5th November
item.description:
One of the traffic lights here appears to be damaged and looks less secure than it should be. It seems to have been hit or twisted, and it’s now leaning at an odd angle. It should be checked before it becomes a safety hazard for both drivers and pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haverstock Hill, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Corner of Chalcot Sq near number 21, 5th November
item.description:
The drain in the lower section of the square near number 21 is currently blocked. This area is prone to flooding due to its dropped level, so the drain needs to be cleared as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chalcot Square, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
